data.title: Brexit – Home Office in the media
data.meta_description: News and updates from Home Office Media
data.text:
Reaction to Guy Verhofstadt's comments on the EU Settlement Scheme

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Leading stories

Today's top story includes the latest EU Settlement Scheme statistics and a reaction to Guy Verhofstadt's comments.

Read more of Reaction to Guy Verhofstadt's comments on the EU Settlement Scheme

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Leading stories

Today's top stories includes coverage of attacks on frontline emergency service workers, EU citizens and drugs associated with GHB.

Home Office in the media: Wednesday 9 October

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Leading stories

Today's leading stories include the allocation of additional police officers, and passport renewals ahead of the UK's departure from the EU. Police recruitment There is coverage of the announcement on the allocation of the first cohort of the 20,000 additional …

Read more of Home Office in the media: Wednesday 9 October

Security Minister: our border will be ready for Brexit

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Ministerial opinion

This week, the Minister of State for Security and Deputy for EU Exit and No Deal Preparation, Brandon Lewis, wrote in the Times about UK border security and Brexit preparation. His words can be found below. Our borders are ready — for traders, …

Read more of Security Minister: our border will be ready for Brexit

Home Office in the media: Thursday 5 September

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Leading stories

Today's leading stories include the launch of a national campaign to recruit 20,000 police officers, an announcement on future immigration and a High Court ruling on facial recognition. Police recruitment The launch of the campaign to recruit 20,000 additional police …

Read more of Home Office in the media: Thursday 5 September

Media factsheet: EU citizens and freedom of movement

Posted by: Home Office news team, Posted on: - Categories: Fact sheet

After the United Kingdom has left the European Union, the Government will bring in new immigration arrangements. The following factsheet sets out some of the main points and links to wider information where it is available.

Read more of Media factsheet: EU citizens and freedom of movement

Today's Home Office stories include the Home Secretary designating Hizballah a terrorist organisation, Shamima Begum and EU citizens’ rights in UK. Hizballah ban extension There is widespread coverage of the Home Secretary’s decision to ban all wings of Hizballah after …
